definition: to try one's utmost/to strive
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: I had no idea in what terms one shouted at koalas, but I did my best.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道别人用什么字眼来叫，不过，我尽力而为啦。

sentences.english: If your goal is to ‘do your best, ’ you probably won’t.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的目标是尽力而为，你或许不会努力。

sentences.english: Also tell what guide dont have to worry about the cast, he will do his best.
sentences.chinese: 亦名告诉何导不用操心剧组的事，他会尽力而为。

sentences.english: So, when that thing happens, you just do what you have to and try your best.
sentences.chinese: 所以，在这种情况下，你只能尽力而为。

sentences.english: Shit happens, especially when a newbie is "trying his best".
sentences.chinese: 天有不测风云，尤其是个新手在“尽力而为”的时候。

sentences.english: All that you do, do with your might; things done by halves are never done right. –R. H. Stoddard.
sentences.chinese: 做一切事情都要尽力而为，半途而废永远不行。

sentences.english: Despite all his efforts, Mr. B failed again and again.
sentences.chinese: 虽然B先生尽力而为，但他还是一再失败。

sentences.english: Do the best you can when the time comes, and if the audience laughs, don't blame me.
sentences.chinese: 演出时尽力而为吧，如果观众笑你，别怪我。

sentences.english: He told his wife, "A man ain't nothing but a man. But, a man always has to do his best."
sentences.chinese: 男人无论什么时候都应该勇挑重任，尽力而为。

sentences.english: Do your best and then let go.
If we canwoult do as we would, we must do as we can.
sentences.chinese: 如不能如愿而行，定须尽力而为。

sentences.english: Now is the time for all of us to do our part.
sentences.chinese: 现在是我们所有的人尽力而为的时候了。

sentences.english: We will try our best to fulfill your requests to your utmost satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 您的要逑我尽力而为，希望这样能让您满意。

sentences.english: Except that his villain is climate change, and while he’s still doing everything he can to avoid a fight, Keith is also stockpiling ammo.
sentences.chinese: 基思尽力而为避免一场战斗，同时他也在贮备弹药。

sentences.english: They who cannot do as they would, must do as they can.
sentences.chinese: 羮不能如愿而行，也须尽力而为。

sentences.english: Should you give me a trial, I will do my utmost to afford you every satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 如有试用的机会，本人必尽力而为，以使贵院满足。

definition: to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
if only it were so/I hope so (idiom)
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
with all of one's heart
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
to insist on/to demand/to impose
life and death are ruled by fate (idiom)
one's limited power (humble expr.)

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
